results.title: The Guns of Navarone
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Cecil F. Ford, Open Road Films and Columbia
results.brief_description: The suspense builds and the drama explodes in J. Lee Thompson’s finely crafted adaptation of Alistair MacLean’s best-selling novel. Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn, David Niven, and Anthony Quayle are allied saboteurs, assigned an impossible mission - infiltrate an impregnable Nazi-held island and destroy two enormous long-range field guns that prevent the rescue of 2000 trapped British soldiers. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations, receiving the Oscar for Best Special Effects, this film is still regarded as one of the greatest action-adventure spectacles ever produced.

results.title: The Gulf between
results.brief_description: Fired from 1000 kilometers away, 39 scud missiles hit Israel during the Gulf War. Two people died as a result of direct hits. Twelve people died from related causes. Thousands of buildings were destroyed. For Israelis the impact of this war spread far beyond this… This documentary uncovers the personal feelings and stories of six ordinary Israelis as they reflect on their experiences during the Gulf War and their belief in the hatred towards Israel by the surrounding Arab States. It would appear that most Israelis want peace but do not agree on how to achieve this end - resigned to the fact that perhaps co-existence with the Palestinians is the only way. However, the Israelis have lived through many wars: War of Independence (1948); Suez crisis (1956); Six Day War (1967); Yom Kippur War (1973); Lebanon War (1982); and are determined not to back down from their fight to keep Israel as the rightful home for Jewish people. Contains strong images of the aftermath of the Gulf War, archival footage of the Holocaust and interviews.

results.title: The Guitar
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
This film briefly outlines the history of the guitar through a period of six thousand years. Guitarist John Williams examines the construction of the instrument; describes the nature and tuning of the strings, placing of the frets, and demonstrates all the varieties of sound possible using music by Bach, Paganini, Weber and Schubert. Includes sequences on the lute, electric guitar and Spanish classical guitar.

results.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
results.brief_description: Janet Ames’ whole world crashes when she learns that her husband has been killed in the war while saving the lives of five other men. Feeling that the survivors had no right to live, she sets out to visit and confront each one. What eventuates though, leaves Janet with a new perspective on life, which is something she did not bargain for.

results.title: The Guide to 35mm photography
results.brief_description: Brian Ratty introduces this instructional video on how to use a 35mm camera. The program is divided into three half-hour chapters. Part one covers: How the SLR works, “f” stops and shutter speeds, exposure, depth of field and film. Part two covers: Lenses, available light, flash, filters and steady shooting. Part three covers: seeing with the camera, candids, portraits, the environmental portrait and sports and action.

results.title: The Guide log
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Girl Guides Association from the enrolment of a Brownie to the work of the Trefoil Guild or Senior Branch. Explains the work and play of the movement: social work, camping, cooking, keeping house, sailing, gliding, etc. Sequences include national dances performed by participation in an international guide camp.

results.title: The Guan Yin Temple
results.brief_description: In this interview, Ralph Beh - a curator at the Golden Dragon Museum in Bendigo dicusses the history and significance of the remarkable murals that adorn the inner walls of the Guan Yin temple on the museum’s grounds.

results.title: The Grudge 2 = Ju-on 2
results.creator_credit: Takashi Shimizu, Takashige Ichise, Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha and Kadokawa Shoten Publishing Company
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “The Grudge”, a Tokyo house has been the site of many strange disappearances. A television crew go to investigate the site, setting off a spate of killings by the evil spirit that dwells there. Although not as well received as “The Grudge” this horror film contains a convoluted narrative, but contains exemplary scares and thrills, fitting for the genre, with a chilling finale. Cast includes: Noriko Sakai, Chiharu Niiyama and Kei Horie.
